org.dockbox.selene.core.impl.files.util

Class XStreamUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dockbox.selene.core.impl.files.util.XStreamUtils

  • public final class XStreamUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class which configures XStream with some default settings and permissions. For simple usage (custom configuration file with only standard fields and collections): 

    
 MyConfigFile config = XStreamUtils.fromXMLQuietly(file,
      MyConfigFile.class, () -> new MyConfigFile());

 XStreamUtils.toXMLQuietly(config, file);

    For complex usage, for example to white list more classes, use a XStreamUtils.XStreamBuilder from create().

    See Also:
    XStream tutorial, XStream security

      static class  XStreamUtils.XStreamBuilder

      • fromXMLQuietly

        @Nullable
public static <T> T fromXMLQuietly(java.io.File file,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                              java.util.function.Supplier<T> fallback)
        Reads an XML file with XStream using UTF-8 encoding using the type's ClassLoader and ignoring any IO exception (returning the fall back). You may still can exception if the XML is not as expected. If you do not need backward compatibility, user XStreamUtils.XStreamBuilder.ignoreUnknownElements() instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to load, be default this type will be white listed, if additional types are needed, use create().allowTypes(types).readQuietly(file, type, fallBack).

      • toXMLQuietly

        public static void toXMLQuietly(java.lang.Object object,
                                java.io.File file)
        Writes an Object to an XML file with XStream using UTF-8 encoding using the object class ClassLoader and ignoring any exception.

      • create

        public static XStreamUtils.XStreamBuilder create()
        Returns:
        a builder to configure the XStream before reading or writing a XML file.
